com.samskivert.util

Class ArrayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.util.ArrayUtil

  • public class ArrayUtil
extends Object
    Miscellaneous utility routines for working with arrays.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte[] EMPTY_BYTE
      An empty (and thus immutable) byte[] that can be shared by anyone.

      static <S,T extends S>
      T[]      		 copy(S[] values, T[] store)
      Similar to Collection.toArray(), this method copies the contents of the first parameter to the second, creating a new array of the same type if the destination array is too small to hold the contents of the source.

      Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1 (inclusive) in the supplied array.

      Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the concatenated subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1, and offset + length to values.length (inclusive) in the supplied array.

      • binarySearch

        public static <T> int binarySearch(T[] array,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length,
                                   Comparable<? super T> key)
        Performs a binary search, attempting to locate the element that compares as equal to the specified Comparable key. Note that the array elements can implement Comparable and the key can be of the same type, or the key can be a completely different class that can compare the element type. All comparisons will be called as key.compareTo(element).
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be searched.
        offset - the index of the first element in the array to be considered.
        length - the number of elements including and following the element at offset to consider when searching.
        key - the Comparable that will be used to search the elements of the array.
        Returns:
        the index of the object in question or (-(insertion point) - 1) (always a negative value) if the object was not found in the list.

      • binarySearch

        public static <T> int binarySearch(T[] array,
                                   int offset,
                                   int length,
                                   T key,
                                   Comparator<T> comp)
        Performs a binary search, attempting to locate the specified object. The array must be in the sort order defined by the supplied Comparator for this to operate correctly.
        Parameters:
        array - the array of objects to be searched.
        offset - the index of the first element in the array to be* considered.
        length - the number of elements including and following the element at offset to consider when searching.
        key - the object to be located.
        comp - the comparator to use when searching.
        Returns:
        the index of the object in question or (-(insertion point) - 1) (always a negative value) if the object was not found in the list.

      • splice

        public static byte[] splice(byte[] values,
                            int offset)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1 (inclusive) in the supplied array.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values to splice.
        offset - the index within the values array after which all subsequent values are to be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.

      • splice

        public static byte[] splice(byte[] values,
                            int offset,
                            int length)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the concatenated subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1, and offset + length to values.length (inclusive) in the supplied array.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values to splice.
        offset - the index within the values array at which the first element will be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.
        length - the number of elements to be removed. Note that offset + length must be a valid index within the values array.

      • splice

        public static short[] splice(short[] values,
                             int offset)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1 (inclusive) in the supplied array.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values to splice.
        offset - the index within the values array after which all subsequent values are to be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.

      • splice

                             int offset,
                             int length)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the concatenated subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1, and offset + length to values.length (inclusive) in the supplied array.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values to splice.
        offset - the index within the values array at which the first element will be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.
        length - the number of elements to be removed. Note that offset + length must be a valid index within the values array.

      • splice

        public static <T> T[] splice(T[] values,
                             int offset,
                             int length)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the concatenated subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1, and offset + length to values.length (inclusive) in the supplied array. The type of the array is preserved.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of values to splice.
        offset - the index within the values array at which the first element will be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.
        length - the number of elements to be removed. Note that offset + length must be a valid index within the values array.

      • splice

      • splice

                             int offset,
                             int length)
        Creates and returns a new array sized to fit and populated with the concatenated subset of values from indexes 0 to offset - 1, and offset + length to values.length (inclusive) in the supplied array.

        offset - the index within the values array at which the first element will be removed. This must be a valid index within the values array.
        length - the number of elements to be removed. Note that offset + length must be a valid index within the values array.

        public static <T> T[] insert(T[] values,
                             T value,
                             int index)
        Creates a new array one larger than the supplied array and with the specified value inserted into the specified slot. The type of the values array will be preserved.

      • copy

        public static <S,T extends S> T[] copy(S[] values,
                                       T[] store)
        Similar to Collection.toArray(), this method copies the contents of the first parameter to the second, creating a new array of the same type if the destination array is too small to hold the contents of the source.
